observationText: The hTERT ipn02.8 cell line was derived from immortalization of normal human Schwann cells using hTERT and CDK4 transgenes. It has been expanded to at least passage 83 without signs of senescence.
observationType: ['Cell line derivation', 'Cell line immortalization', 'Cell line growth characteristics']

observationText: The hTERT ipn02.8 cell line was used for testing the effect of drugs like the MEK inhibitor on cell viability in 2D culture, with a plating density of 1800 cells per well in a 96-well plate.
Single cell clones were derived from the hTERT ipn02.8 cell line, demonstrating that it can be clonally expanded.
The hTERT ipn02.8 cell line was one of the wild-type immortalized Schwann cell lines used in a high-throughput drug library screen.
